title: Drawing, "Horseshoe Fall from the North, Niagara", September 1858
medium: Graphite, brush and white gouache on light-brown wove paper.
inscribed:
Recto: Dated in graphite, at bottom right: [1858, September]
Verso: Numbered in graphite, at top edge, one through eight.
description:
Recto: Horizontal view of Horseshoe Falls from the North with a steamer visible near it on the river; strokes of a scale, at top edge.

Verso: Top and bottom edges show scales, with the first one numbered up to "8."

exhibitions.title: Frederic Church, Winslow Homer & Thomas Moran: Tourism and the American Landscape

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Horseshoe Fall from the North, Niagara", September 1858.
September 1858. Graphite, brush and white gouache on light-brown wove paper.. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-55-b.
